name: DETAIL - Is there a Safe Work Method Statement for this task?
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Relevant parties to review, Note Method statement in the Comments
DETAIL - Review relevent design / task characteristics and identify hold points
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - All design requirements are met
DETAIL - Is a temporary works design required for this task?
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Temporary Works design completed and attached
RECORDS - TW design, Sign off this task
DETAIL - If relevant attach technical reports
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - All related reports attached
DETAIL - If required provide required laboratory testing reports, material designs and attach i.e. grading curves, concrete design, steel certs etc.
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - All related reports are attached
RECORDS - Laboratory test results, Sign off this task
DETAIL - Complete any field testing and Checksheets required by permanent design or temporary works design
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - All related reports are attached
RECORDS - Field Test, Sign off this task
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - All related photos are attached
RECORDS - Photo records, Sign off this task

CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Control Checklist - Digging / Excavating (incl. marking out & potholing existing services), PTW #2 Trench Excavation Inspection, Notify Worksafe NZ if required. Ensure all necessary Permit to Works & Controlled Checklists are in place
RECORDS - Permit attached or permit number noted
DETAIL - Ensure that Design is approved and Drawings are of the latest revision
DETAIL - Setout inlet & outlet points with inverts as required by Contractor to construct to design
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Survey is correct and consistent with plans
DETAIL - Bedding, Side support and Overlay materials tested in accordance with Specifications
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Council Water Main Specification - NTLDM
DETAIL - Confirm pipes diameter, class & jointing type, as well as manholes, are as shown on the drawings, and that the pipes/pre-cast units are correct and in good condition.
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Pipe - Diameter & Class, Wingwalls, Manholes, Cesspits etc.
DETAIL - Flanges, Valve boxes, Fire Hydrants, bolts, nuts, washers shall be as in accordance with the Specifications
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Council Water Main Specification - NTLDM
DETAIL - Inspect trench profile and ensure it is correct to lines and levels to design. Ensure trench width is sufficient to provide enough space on either side of the pipe for compaction
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - 350mm for external dia >900. DN900 for SW1, Line and level is correct
DETAIL - Base of trenching to be inspected by Design Engineer. If undercutting required or excess water encountered, backfill material and method to be agreed before proceeding
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Review Inferred CBRs with Design Engineer to sign-off
DETAIL - Bedding to be placed and compacted 150mm thick bedding for pipe dia between 450 to 1500
○ Clegg hammer CIV = >25 in engineered fill, and within berm (if req'd) CIV = >20
DETAIL - The pipes shall be laid with the variation between the specified invert level and invert level laid shall not exceed 5mm
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Vertical tolerance +/- 5mm, unless approved by eng rep
DETAIL - Pipe invert checks shall be carried out at least once per day with a maximum of 20m between checks.
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Vertical tolerance +/- 5mm, unless approved by eng rep
DETAIL - Inspect pipes prior to backfilling to ensure they have been installed correctly and the joints are in place. Check for gaps and/or defects and check pipe alignment for straightness
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - No defects/ gaps / pipes are aligned correctly
DETAIL - Backfill compacted and tested in 200mm thick layers
— Clegg CIV >25 for engineered fill. In berms, Photo record.
— 95% MDD under carriageway for engineered fill. In berms, Photo record
— 98% MDD for engineered fill. In berms, Photo record
DETAIL - Base of structure to be tested. Scala's to be minimum of 3 blows per 100mm
DETAIL - Structures to be installed to the design survey location and level
DETAIL - Corbals to be poured around each connection to a manhole structure
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Pipe joint to structure shall be encased in 200mm (min.) thick 20MPa concrete
DETAIL - As-built survey of the structure and all invert levels
DETAIL - For pipes <900mm a CCTV inspection must be completed. Pipes >900mm must be visually inspected
FREQUENCY - At completion of the works
DETAIL - If required, testing for water tightness in the structures and low pressure air testing of the pipelines is to be carried out - test sheets to be filling in where required
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Drainage Structure Water Tightness Test Record & Low Pressure Air Test Record
DETAIL - Ensure all drainage lines comply with design prior to carrying on with next construction process
FREQUENCY - At completion of drainage line
DETAIL - Updated drawings to be submitted with As-built line and levels recorded
FREQUENCY - At the completion of the Lot of work
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Council Water Main Specification - NTLDM

CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Control Checklist - Digging / Excavating (incl. marking out & potholing existing services), PTW #1 - Confined Space, PTW #2 - Trench Excavation Inspection, Notify Worksafe NZ if required. Ensure all necessary Permit to Works & Controlled Checklists are in place

DETAIL - Ensure cables, transformers and ring main units are to (service Providers) specifications

DETAIL - Inspect trench profile and ensure it is correct to lines and levels set out by survey
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Depth and line is correct as per for construction drawings
DETAIL - 100mm thick bedding to be placed and compacted and cable laid (by other)
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - >100mm of clean sand bedding
DETAIL - As built survey at intervals of no more than 20m and at each change in direction
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - As-built points spacing to be less than 20m at all times

— Clegg CIV >25 for engineered fill. In berms, Photo record.
— 95% MDD under carriageway for engineered fill. In berms, Photo record
— 98% MDD for engineered fill. In berms, Photo record

DETAIL - PE Pipe installed by drilling to survey setout, draw wire/draw rope installed and cable pulled through pipe
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Line and depth consistent with for construction drawings
DETAIL - As built survey of the PE pipe installed including depth using depths marked by drilling contractors
FREQUENCY - After duct has been installed
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - As-built points spacing to be less than 20m at all times
DETAIL - Backfill connection pits, Sand placed to bed cabling. Clean Insitu backfill material to be placed and compacted in 300mm lifts to meet power providers specification.
— Clegg CIV >25 for engineered fill. In berms, Photo record.
— 95% MDD under carriageway for engineered fill. In berms, Photo record
— 98% MDD for engineered fill. In berms, Photo record
DETAIL - Feature such as poles, transformers, distribution pillars installed as per IFC drawings

DETAIL - Remove all other redundant items such as redundant poles, pillar boxes, overhead lines etc.
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Site clear of redundant items

DETAIL - Fire Hydrant Lids shall be painted golden yellow. A yellow triangle shall be painted on or near the centre line of the road and RRPM. A yellow circle encircling the hydrant shall be painted if its location can be obscured by parked vehicles.
